Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2014 10:29AM Susan0522 wrote: I. Had my port in Monday and no problem.  Twilight anesthesia so in and out of the hospital In about 3.5 hours. Currently sitting in the infusion chair for my first TC.   1 almost down and 5 to go.  Take care ladies and thanks for sharing all your experiences with us.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2014 08:15AM Susan0522 wrote: Did they tell you to put the cream on in a larger amount, like a big glob and cover with press and seal saran wrap?  I have done that with my dermatologist and it works great.  I had my first port access on wednesday and left from work and forgot to put on my cream so I had a minor freak out when I got to chemo but they used a freezing spray and I had no access pain at that time.  It pinched a bit when they pulled it out three hours later but I bet if I remembered the cream that might had helped.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23
